bow: week old at wedding my little brother is getting married when my baby will be weeks old that if he over week late he may be older we are traveling to the wedding and feel okay about the flight enjoy the wedding love to take her up on this offer however planning to breast feed and do know if can really be away from him at all during this time do know how good ll be at pumping either and not opposed to formula but was sorta hoping to breast feed at least throughout my entire maternity leave months moms what do you think will be able to leave my baby at all would it be possible to bring him for little while to breast feed and get some pictures in and then we ll take him to the hotel 10 15 mins away where grandma will watch him in our room until we return hours later it depends on the baby of course but honestly at weeks baby is most likely just eating sleeping and pooping would get good baby carrier that you could strap on one of those fabric ones and just wear him also not wear one piece outfit like dress because that would be pain in the ass to nurse with we had similar situation come up bought our daughter was older maybe months and my in laws took her for the wedding and reception couldn pump much breast milk and they took her to boston market and fed her mashed potatoes didn even use the minimal breast milk gave them was pissed this sounds like sweet setup would bring baby with me to the wedding for the first hour or so then nurse and off with grandma he goes you ll only need to pump if you re missing nursing session so if you time it right that wo be necessary at weeks out you need to be careful about maintaining supply that why you need to pump most babies of that age go hours between feedings some like mine only make sure you order birth certificate rush at the hospital for the wedding and the airport suggest baby wearing it ll keep the baby tucked next to you if you are ready to leave the baby for the whole hours also suggest getting nursing dress for the event for easier access think thats totally doable my daughter was months old when my husband and were both in the bridal party at my sils wedding so hair makeup pictures etc all beyond our control in terms of schedule my parents watched my daughter while did hair and make up in hotel room nursed her kept her with me during pictures my mom held her for the ceremony and then me and baby left the reception early she wasnt the type of baby that would settle and sleep without me around am so glad that we went cos baby and were able to share once in lifetime event with sil think having baby around for pictures and nursing is totally doable think going home with grandma will depend on baby my girl nursed every 60 90 minutes at that age so oped to just leave early with her but some babies are fine for couple hours between nursing do think you would need to pump unless you plan on totally missing nursing session get yourself good baby carrier and you will be totally fine at weeks old that baby can just sleep on you and even nurse in the carrier they are still total barnacle at that age totally doable attended wedding when my first was weeks old and another when he was months old left him with my parents for the ceremony and then picked him up and brought him to the reception for about an hour and then left he and were both exhausted was happy to attend the important part of the wedding and happy to head home after things started getting rowdy the wedding at months he stayed with me while the ceremony happened and then we had to hang out outside the reception hall because the music was wayyyyyyy too loud for little ears something to think about if you want to keep baby with you when my daughter was about month old was comfortable leaving her with my fil or regular babysitter for few hours personally was pretty good at pumping and could go up to five hours between sessions if had to thus it would be very possible to leave your lo with your mil omg did even think about the birth certificate for flying thank you so glad just checked jetblue will take photo of the birth certificate passport or immunization record so took my week old to friend wedding my so was the best man so there was any issue at all with bringing her she slept pretty much all the time woke up to get changed and fed then straight back to sleep she did object to her daddy best man speech but we called it heckling and had laugh about it my folks came and picked her up before the evening celebrations and we collected her 3hrs later she was bottlefed so did need to worry about feeding her but let me tell you those last three hours were unexpectedly bad missed her did know how she was mean she with my mum obvs she fine and spent it all clock watching sounds like you ve got good plan with mil though would personally take the baby with me was in the same situation last year had week old and it was the year four of my siblings were graduating college so we travelled all over california was breastfeeding and pumping just stuck it through and breastfed we went to supplementing at months and only formula at months so not opposed to formula would stick out only breastfeeding as long as you can do think someone else wedding is worth the change in their diet ve attended weddings 2x while breastfeeding albeit not at weeks pretty extensive weddings too they lasted hours and hours so had to be prepared if your babysitting situation is completely comfortable it is doable introduce bottle beforehand rent buy pump and know how to use it be comfortable with it call the venue ahead of time to find quite and private spot to pump and if the have refrigerated storage for you or pack cooler with ice packs it went well the staff was very friendly and helpful definitely doable points to note wear patterned dress it will hide any sick dribble poop only if he has the audacity of course also make sure it forgiving in the chest area because your boobs will change size quite significantly as they fill up between feeds he may refuse bottle if otherwise exclusively breastfeeding about half of babies that old are still feeding every hours so you may need to consider how to work around that nurse him just before he goes and pop across the road later perhaps if needed you may be utterly snookered at just weeks post partum so prepare yourself for not feeling up to being out and dolled up for too long also you may just hate leaving your baby this soon hormones are still totally out of whack and finally just general note to bear in mind that you will still very much be in recovery at this point even if you have text book birth you will likely still be bleeding generally wo feel up to strength yet etc do expect too much of yourself at this point and be aware you will fatigue faster than you re used to that said sure you ll have lovely time enjoy if you do pump check with the wedding venue and see if they can store your milk for you too guest at my brother wedding was nursing and the venue threw fit over storing her milk that is until stepped in and chewed them out this is only my experience but had hard time being away from my baby for even short periods of time so just be prepared to feel different about the situation once you re in it just something to think about check the airline requirements flew with my yo last year and didn have to provide identification for her my sister flew flies regularly with her little ones including when they were month old and never had to provide identification okay air lines and air ports do need identification until the child is full passenger years give your local airport and the airport you are leaving from call then call the air lines hours away with month old sounds like ticket to engorgement land at weeks needed to fed or pump every 3hours or be mess plus often leaked in between cause my milk supply was huge if you decide to go make sure to bring extra clothes you ll also need to think of how you ll store milk if you pump and if the venue will have space for you to pump totally doable some thoughts for preparation introduce one bottle feeding day pretty early on we started at week old philips avent natural bottles and baby never questioned it this has been godsend as it has allowed dad to feed grandparents to babysit briefly and the flexibility for all of us to leave the house without worrying about where to nurse you will still need to pump during this daily bottle to make the next day bottle pumping is frustrating at first but stick with it and by weeks old you should be able to get some small freezer stash going early morning is the best time to get some extra for the freezer what kind of pump do you have does it have battery or will you need to plug it in will it be easily portable baby carrier will be perfect for this event but you might want to have few options on hand and make sure to practice before the big event so baby is used to it we have both ktan and an ergo and baby is still skeptical of ktan but was totally happy in the ergo for up to hours at weeks think about how car seat will work if you handoff to grandparents and practice can you do baseless seatbelt install or should you buy grandparents their own base do some reading on alcohol and breastmilk and figure out what you feel comfortable with ahead of time so you can enjoy yourself worry free to piggy back off the patterned dress idea think about how you are gon na get those boobs out for feeding sessions avoid back zippers and side sippers at all costs wrap dress or cross over neckline in stretchy fabric will be good idea depending on how comfortable you are feeding in public you can had whole sections of my wardrobe that did wear during maternity leave because it was too hard to feed while wearing them at that age my son often nursed every hour my sister found dress that zipped up in the front that she wore to my wedding when her still nursing son was mo with my last one started pumping day or two for freezer stash around weeks so you ll be fine make sure you attempt bottle with baby several times prior if you go that route it might not be an issue of having the milk but if he likes the bottle advent has been really successful in our house it really fine to do that anyway if you plan on baby going to daycare my youngest had bottle introduced at very young age breastmilk and formula and really preferred the bottle my youngest will hold at daycare for the boob it quite funny how he knows after his 2nd bottle mama coming to pick him up honestly with the flu season being as bad as it is would try to limit your child to the amount of people he sees get immediate family members but randoms at wedding are not going to understand that you should not touch baby if you feel even remotely off also they should be washing their hands before they touch your baby so bring ton of hand sanitizer if this wo happen during flu season extended past april
